page.title: 05FORESTRY FARMING IN CANNICH
page.content: Approximately 1/3 of this area is {forestry}property, mostly public, some private. 23% of the total area is of commercial plantations of conifers, the other 10% being naturally regenerated hardwoods, non-woodland areas in{agricultural}use and land for housing, administration and{amenity. Cannich, though of decreasing importance, is the forest centre for approximately 30,000 ha. of forest land, 8000 ha. of this being woodland, the remainder being largely mountain- ous, infertile and inaccessible. It is only suitable for letting as deer forest, with some agricultural use, and largely used for public amenity activities such as hill walking and rock climbing. There are 20 local people directly employed by the { Forestry Commission, 16 of whom live in the 12km block.
